descript.abstract: The Horizon Consistence table contains descriptive terms of soil consistence -- rupture resistance, plasticity, and stickiness -- for the referenced horizon. One row in this table is marked as having the representative characteristics for the horizon.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 7 Version 6.1 (Build 7601) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.1.1.3143

attr.attrdef: The rupture resistance of a block-shaped specimen of 25 to 30 mm size and dry water state. (SSM)
The rupture resistance of a block-like specimen of 25 to 30 mm size that has been air dried and then submerged in water. (SSM)

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: A non-connotative string of characters used to uniquely identify a record in the Horizon Consistence table.
A yes/no field that indicates if a set of descriptors of soil consistence is representative for the horizon.
The unique identifier of a record in the Horizon table. Use this column to join the Horizon Consistence table to the Horizon table.
The degree to which a puddled, wet soil mass is permanently deformed without rupturing by a slow continuous application of force in any direction. (SSM)
The rupture resistance of an air dry plate-shaped specimen of specified size. (SSM)
The manner in which soil specimens fail under increasing force. (SSM)
The rupture resistance of a block-shaped specimen of 25 to 30 mm size and moist water state. (SSM)
The maximum capacity of thoroughly puddled soil to adhere to other objects.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
